cab.content: . ' 49CONFIDENTIAL LIBRARY" "(THIS DOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY 01-' HIS BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENT)S EGRET. ;:: , )COPY HO. MC.P.406(25). " : "CABINET oARRIVAL OF THE PRINCE QE WALES.The attached letter from Colonel Sir George Crichton to Sir Ronald Waterhouse, regarding the return of the Prince of Wales, is circulated to Members of the Cabinet who are requested to inform the Prime Minister (or Sir Patrick Gowsr on his behalf) at their earliest convenience if they will be available on the 9th October.(Signed) M*P.A. HAHKEY,Secretary, Cabinet.2 Whitehall Gardens, S.W.I., 21st September, 1925. LORD CHAMBLf iLA IK 1 S OFFICE, ST. JAMES1 S PALACE,S.Wol.18th September, 1925.My dear-Waterhouse,The I-rinoe of Wales is due to arrive in London from his Tour in South Africa and South America, so far as can he ascertained at present, during the afternoon of the 9th of October nest.In this connection, will you he good enough to send me a list of the Members of the Cabinet who will be in London on that date, as The Xing wishes them to he invited to be present at the Railway Station on His Royal Highness's arrival.Victoria will probably be the Railway Station at which His Royal Highness will arrive,, and Levee Dress will be worn on the occasion.Yours sincerely, (Signed) G0 CRICHTOK.Lieut-colonel sir Ronald Waterhouse,ICC.Bo ,C.MoCro ,C.V.O.
